goal.ch:
"Reverse engineering (RE) is a technique extensively used in current industry for
the digitization of a physical part and the reconstruction of its geometric model. It
employs a digitization system to obtain the cloud points on the surface of a part,
typically saved as triangular data called STL data. The STL data can be used in
different applications, including CAD model reconstruction, part inspection,
visualization, etc. The purpose of this course is to teach the technology related to
reverse engineering, which includes the introduction of three-dimensional (3D)
scanning devices, coordinate geometry and coordinate transformation, points and
triangular data processing, geometric modelling, curve and surface interpolation and
fitting. This course not only teach the material related to reverse engineering, but also
emphasizes software operation. A reverse engineering software will be used in this
course to help students to understand all RE techniques lectured. It is expected that
students can understand most of the techniques in reverse engineering and can
perform CAD model reconstruction using RE software in this course."
goal.en:
"Reverse engineering (RE) is a technique extensively used in current industry for
the digitization of a physical part and the reconstruction of its geometric model. It
employs a digitization system to obtain the cloud points on the surface of a part,
typically saved as triangular data called STL data. The STL data can be used in
different applications, including CAD model reconstruction, part inspection,
visualization, etc. The purpose of this course is to teach the technology related to
reverse engineering, which includes the introduction of three-dimensional (3D)
scanning devices, coordinate geometry and coordinate transformation, points and
triangular data processing, geometric modelling, curve and surface interpolation and
fitting. This course not only teach the material related to reverse engineering, but also
emphasizes software operation. A reverse engineering software will be used in this
course to help students to understand all RE techniques lectured. It is expected that
students can understand most of the techniques in reverse engineering and can
perform CAD model reconstruction using RE software in this course."
